This is a judgement (evaluation) type of question because you have to work out how the author has written the text. The clue is that the 'props' are what is required to do the trick.

Tips for a judgement (evaluation) type of question

For some questions, you can find the answer in the text by reading and selecting sentences carefully and then making a judgement about the information provided, in order to work out the final answer.

For other questions, you will have to combine the facts that you read in the text with your own knowledge and observations, in order to work out the final answer.

success.question_text: The printed poem can be dispensed with

review_1.column_1_text:
Explanation

Click OPEN ANSWER PDF to see the lines highlighted in green. These lines show you where the answer can be found.

This is an inferring (working out) type of question because you have to 'read between the lines' when you read part of the text. The clue is in the part of the text where you give “your printed page to a friend” to prompt you and you are then “on your way to becoming a performance poet”. It is implied that the page is no longer required if the reciting has been mastered.

Tip for an inferring (working out) type of question

To find the answer you have to 'read between the lines' as this type of question is based on material that does not jump out and give you the answer straightaway. You need to know about material in the text and then combine it with your own knowledge and understanding to work out the final answer.

choice_1.label: once sections to learn have been marked off.

choice_3.label: when the page is no longer readable.

choice_4.label: after the first successful public performance.

success.question_text: What would be the most important step in learning a poem to recite?

review_1.column_1_text:
Explanation

Click OPEN ANSWER PDF to see the lines highlighted in green. These lines show you where the answer can be found.

This is a judgement (evaluation) type of question because you have to work out how the author has written the text. The clues are in the reasons why you might have to learn a poem by heart and the assumption that you would select a familiar poem.

Tips for a judgement (evaluation) type of question

For some questions, you can find the answer in the text by reading and selecting sentences carefully and then making a judgement about the information provided, in order to work out the final answer.

For other questions, you will have to combine the facts that you read in the text with your own knowledge and observations, in order to work out the final answer.

choice_2.label: reciting the poem in front of a prompt

choice_3.label: marking off sections of the poem to be memorised
